slides.title: Averages
slides.content:
**Average = Sum of all values / Number of values**

**Examples:**
Average of 10, 20, 30 = (10+20+30)/3 = 20

**Key Properties:**
- If all numbers increase by x, average increases by x
- Adding a number > average increases average
- Adding a number < average decreases average

slides.title: Ratio & Proportion
slides.content:
**Ratio:** a:b means a/b
*Example:* 2:3 means 2/3

**Proportion:** a:b = c:d → a×d = b×c

**Divide amount in ratio:**
₹100 in 2:3 = 2/(2+3)×100 : 3/(2+3)×100 = ₹40 : ₹60

slides.title: Mixtures & Alligation
slides.content:
**Alligation Rule:** Mix two quantities at different prices

**Formula:** Cheaper quantity / Dearer quantity = (Mean Price - Cheaper) / (Dearer - Mean Price)

**Example:** Mix ₹10/kg and ₹15/kg items to get ₹12/kg
Ratio = (12-10)/(15-12) = 2/3 = 2:3
